channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What does 15 look like? Teens and former child actors weigh in online after Megyn Kelly comments
item.description: After commentator Megyn Kelly seemed to downplay the youth of Jeffrey Epstein's victims, former child actresses and current teenagers took to social media to express outrage.
item.content:encoded:
After commentator Megyn Kelly seemed to downplay the youth of Jeffrey Epstein's victims, former child actresses and current teenagers took to social media to express outrage.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: How volunteering led one woman to lifelong friendships and a chicken tattoo
item.description: This week Here to Help, our series on volunteerism, travels to New York for a story of close friendships that formed while caring for school yard chickens.
item.content:encoded: This week Here to Help, our series on volunteerism, travels to New York for a story of close friendships that formed while caring for school yard chickens.
item.dc:creator: Jeanette Woods

item.title: In Ben Stiller's showbiz family, there was little separation between home and stage
item.description: After his parents died, Stiller found a stash of their audio recordings. Those tapes of comedians Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara are at the center of the documentary Stiller & Meara: Nothing Is Lost.
item.content:encoded: After his parents died, Stiller found a stash of their audio recordings. Those tapes of comedians Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara are at the center of the documentary Stiller & Meara: Nothing Is Lost.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: What do actual witches think of 'Wicked'?
item.description: Mostly they're charmed. Some witches we talked to couldn't wait for the new Wicked release. But some worry that the films have helped move the secret, spiritual art of witchcraft into the mainstream.
item.content:encoded:
Mostly they're charmed. Some witches we talked to couldn't wait for the new Wicked release. But some worry that the films have helped move the secret, spiritual art of witchcraft into the mainstream.

(Image credit: Universal Pictures)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: 40 years ago, Calvin and Hobbes' raucous adventures burst onto the comics page
item.description: The adventures of a precocious 6-year-old and his stuffed tiger debuted on November 18, 1985. NPR's Renee Montagne spoke with the comic strip's editor, Lee Salem, in 2005.
item.content:encoded:
The adventures of a precocious 6-year-old and his stuffed tiger debuted on November 18, 1985. NPR's Renee Montagne spoke with the comic strip's editor, Lee Salem, in 2005.

(Image credit: Jackie Ellis)
item.dc:creator: Renee Montagne

item.title: This week in books: Get stuck in a Nov. 18 time loop, and explore the world in 70 maps
item.description: This week brings new releases from Joy Williams, Simon Winchester and Tracy K. Smith, among other talented writers.
item.content:encoded: This week brings new releases from Joy Williams, Simon Winchester and Tracy K. Smith, among other talented writers.
item.dc:creator: Colin Dwyer

item.title: These San Antonio grandmas show cultural pride and 'stay young' by dancing folklórico
item.description: A dozen Latina grandmothers ages 73 to 86 formed a folklórico dance group in San Antonio known as Las Abuelitas De Oro, with a goal of sharing their cultural heritage with newer generations.
item.content:encoded: A dozen Latina grandmothers ages 73 to 86 formed a folklórico dance group in San Antonio known as Las Abuelitas De Oro, with a goal of sharing their cultural heritage with newer generations.
item.dc:creator: Ivanna Bass Caldera

item.title: 'What you see is really me,' says 'Wicked' star Cynthia Erivo
item.description: Erivo says she found parallels between her life and the experience of her Wicked character, Elphaba. Her new memoir is called Simply More: A Book for Anyone who Has Been Told They're Too Much.
item.content:encoded:
Erivo says she found parallels between her life and the experience of her Wicked character, Elphaba. Her new memoir is called Simply More: A Book for Anyone who Has Been Told They're Too Much.

(Image credit: Lisa O'Connor)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: How women over 30 are rewriting the single mom narrative in America
item.description: Forty percent of babies in the U.S. are born to unmarried mothers. Increasingly, those moms are over 30, at a time when teen pregnancy has fallen off a cliff and births are declining for younger women.
item.content:encoded:
Forty percent of babies in the U.S. are born to unmarried mothers. Increasingly, those moms are over 30, at a time when teen pregnancy has fallen off a cliff and births are declining for younger women.

(Image credit: Maansi Srivastava)
item.dc:creator: Pallavi Gogoi

item.title: President Trump wants Seth Meyers fired. The FCC chair amplified the message
item.description: President Trump continues to rage over late night comedians who make fun of him. This weekend he posted on social media that Seth Meyers has "no talent" and called for NBC to fire him.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump continues to rage over late night comedians who make fun of him. This weekend he posted on social media that Seth Meyers has "no talent" and called for NBC to fire him.

(Image credit: Frazer Harrison)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair
